title: Towie's Olivia Attwood terrorised by mystery masked-man
text:
It’s safe to say they were frightened… (Picture: Beretta/Sims/REX)

Olivia Attwood almost jumped out of her skin when she was spotted filming scenes for Towie this week.

The 28-year-old was sitting in the passenger seat of Chloe Sims’ car when a mystery man wearing a scary face mask came and gave them a fright – and it’s safe to say their faces were a picture.

Chloe and Olivia did not look amused when the masked man came out of nowhere – but his identity remains a mystery – who do you think it was?

We are not completely sure what is going on in the pictures, but we can only imagine the cast are filming for their Towie Halloween Special.

It’s not the first time Chloe has been scared by a masked man because in 2016 Liam Gatsby thought it would be funny to jump out at her and Gemma Collins.

Although the prank soon backfired because he ended up having two drinks thrown on him at the end of the night.

Earlier this week Olivia was spotted again filming for the reality show, but she wasn’t wearing her engagement ring.

Well they weren’t expecting that! (Picture: Beretta/Sims/REX)

Who is the masked man? (Picture: Beretta/Sims/REX)

Instead she was pictured wearing a square diamond ring, rather than the stunning oval-shaped sparkler Bradley Dack used to propose – although not to panic because Olivia’s beau was seen picking her up after filming (and she was wearing her engagement ring, phew).

The couple shared their happy news with Olivia’s Instagram followers last weekend with Bradley proposing on their romantic getaway to Dubai.

In sweet photos shared on her page, Olivia and Bradley are seen kissing and smiling for the camera in front of the Burj Al Arab, while showing off the large diamond ring on her left hand.

‘He must be crazy… Here’s to forever. I love you BD.’ (Picture:Instagram)

Olivia cheekily captioned the announcement: ‘He must be crazy… Here’s to forever. I love you BD.’

The couple were flooded with congratulatory messages from their celebrity pals, including Olivia’s Love Island co-star Gabby Allen, who wrote: ‘OH MY GOD!!! Congratulations you two. Wowwwwww.’

Olivia’s Love Island bestie Amber Davies was clearly a little overwhelmed with her friend’s happy news and simply wrote: ‘I JUST CAN’T COPE.’

Other stars to congratulate the newly-engaged couple include Gemma Collins, Bobby Norris, Olivia Buckland, Sam Faiers and Nicola McClean.

It’s been a fairly rocky road for Olivia and Bradley, who dated before she found fame on ITV’s Love Island in 2017.

They’ve since broken up several times, most recently in April when Olivia confirmed their split on her Instagram Stories, only to reconcile with the footballer two days later.
